head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Teachers' Union Chief Re-Elected

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Teachers' Union Chief Re-Elected

body.head.byline: By STEVEN GREENHOUSE; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: Randi Weingarten is re-elected president of United Federation of Teachers, union that represents 70,000 New York City public school teachers and 17,000 classroom paraprofessionals (S)

block.p: Randi Weingarten, the president of the United Federation of Teachers, was overwhelmingly re-elected to a three-year term. The union, which represents 70,000 New York City public school teachers and 17,000 classroom paraprofessionals, announced on Friday that Ms. Weingarten had received 40,665 votes, or 87 percent of those cast, while her opponent, Kit Wainer, received 6,070. This will be Ms. Weingarten's fourth full term. In 1998, she was appointed to fill the remainder of Sandra Feldman's term, after Ms. Feldman ascended to become president of the parent union, the American Federation of Teachers.

Randi Weingarten, the president of the United Federation of Teachers, was overwhelmingly re-elected to a three-year term. The union, which represents 70,000 New York City public school teachers and 17,000 classroom paraprofessionals, announced on Friday that Ms. Weingarten had received 40,665 votes, or 87 percent of those cast, while her opponent, Kit Wainer, received 6,070. This will be Ms. Weingarten's fourth full term. In 1998, she was appointed to fill the remainder of Sandra Feldman's term, after Ms. Feldman ascended to become president of the parent union, the American Federation of Teachers.
